ygData.subject: Re: PvP Bard
ygData.msgSnippet: I play a pvp bard on Rallos Zek and it s relatively easy to stay alive as long as you have Selo s accelerando and a drum.  Groups of Pkers are not a common
ygData.messageBody:
I play a pvp bard on Rallos Zek and it's relatively easy to stay alive as
long as you have Selo's accelerando and a drum. Groups of Pkers are not a
common occurrance but it does happen. There are such guilds out there,
namely Enemies of Norrath, Covetous Crew, and on the lighter side of things
Bane of the Living.

Ka`Lend

-----Original Message-----
From: dean_witcraft@... [mailto:dean_witcraft@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 5:31 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] PvP Bard


From: dean_witcraft@...

I play Stargazer Erudite Enchanter on Fennin Ro almost exclusively.
I have a Barbarian Shaman level 5 also on Fennin Ro but he's just sitting
there waiting for me to get bored playing my enchanter.

In my frustration with the lack of role-playing on Fennin Ro, I started a
bard on the PvP server (my first PvP experience) and ran him up to lvl 4 or
5, but the first couple of times I took him out of the newbie zone I found
groups of level 8 dark elves sitting there PKing over and over again without
so much as a nod to rp'ing so I gave that up for the time being. Is anyone
playing a PvP bard. Is this experience typical?
Any suggestions on how to stay alive?
